items.text: drags it down short, and he rocks back to pull, but can't get hold of it. It goes to mid-on
stays back to push this to point
tossed up on leg and middle, gets the batsman forward to defend

items.preText: Ibrahim: "Bangladesh would either score above 280, or below 230. The batting line-up would not allow anything in between. "
items.text: short ball outside off, Shakib completely mis-times his pull. Too early into the shot, gets it on the end of the bat and the ball travels down to long-on
items.shortText: Roach to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: short and wide outside off, stroked to deep point fairly easily

items.preText: Mazhar Chowdhur: "@ Saurabh: News from a leading News Paper's online version, Liton hasn't got any fracture but feeling sheer pain. If he manages to control pain, can come to bat again. " - Yes, we actually did put the same info in our commentary too!
items.text: shorter outside off, dabbed to short third man. They decide against the single, rightly so
items.shortText: Roach to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: another good short ball, angling into the stumps and he taps it down near him
items.shortText: Roach to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: good length now, and Shakib was hanging back a bit due to the short balls. A bit late to come down on it, ends up punching it to mid-on off a thickish inside edge
items.shortText: Roach to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: good length on the stumps, chopped to point
items.shortText: Roach to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: Anesu Chimeramo: "@Zaman, i dont think 250 is safe for Bangladesh to defend, West Indies is quite unpredictable considering they have power hitters like Rovman, Hetmyer, Samuels and Bravo. Anything below 280 on this Pitch WI can go for it" - They certainly can go for it, though Darren Bravo isn't really a power hitter. Or wasn't in his last ODI at least
items.text: nicely tossed up on off, turning away, he plays with the spin to push it towards point
slightly short, and he goes deep inside his crease to punch it past cover, who fumbles while trying to dive and field, allowing the single
down the track and takes it on the half-volley, swipes it down to long-on
items.shortText: Bishoo to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: tossed up, very full on the stumps, driven but straight to short cover
squirts it off the outside edge to point. Hung back to this, wasn't short enough, ends up poking at it. The ball turns enough to take the edge
slightly shorter, he stays back and cuts it to deep cover. End of a fantastic spell from Bishoo
items.shortText: Bishoo to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: good length, very straight, and pushed to long-off
items.shortText: Powell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: full ball and very straight, driven to long-on
very full and straight again, driven to long-off from his crease
items.shortText: Powell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: length ball outside off, glides it to point
full, drifting on the pads, but he misses the flick. The ball rolls to short midwicket, and no single there with the bowler quickly across to field
good length, coming back in a touch, defended solidly on off stump

items.preText:
Keemo Paul now, with Bishoo having bowled out his quota

Atiq Sohail: "If Liton comes to bat later on along with Soumya, we would experience two openers slogging the ball to become regular partner with Tamim in the opening pair"
items.text: fuller length on off, driven back past the bowler for a single
items.shortText: Paul to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: back of a length outside of, he tries to dab it past point, but gets n under-edge
loses his line, and that ends up well outside the tram line to be a wide
good length outside off, he lets it come to him and runs it down to third man
